Please hold on mering this PR since ```test_lag_2``` failed on kvm test
```
 def __init__(self, duthost, tbinfo, ptfhost, nbrhosts, fanouthosts, conn_graph_facts):
        self.duthost     = duthost
        self.tbinfo      = tbinfo
        self.ptfhost     = ptfhost
        self.nbrhosts    = nbrhosts
        self.fanouthosts = fanouthosts
        self.mg_facts         = duthost.get_extended_minigraph_facts(tbinfo)
        self.conn_graph_facts = conn_graph_facts
        self.vm_neighbors     = self.mg_facts['minigraph_neighbors']
>       self.fanout_neighbors = self.conn_graph_facts['device_conn'][duthost.hostname] if 'device_conn' in self.conn_graph_facts else {}
E       KeyError: 'vlab-01'
```
Will work on the fix
@SuvarnaMeenakshi Thanks for catching that. Updated.

@smaheshm is the original issue because the test hit a supervisor card? random dut might still land you on supervisor card.

> @smaheshm is the original issue because the test hit a supervisor card? random dut might still land you on supervisor card.

Not on supervisor card. Line card has portChannel and Ethernet Port L3 interfaces. The following code fails for Ethernet port e.g. "Ethernet4" since the redis query uses "PortChannel" in the command.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10645050/138372449-a94ec924-e79f-4905-b895-be25adc3d962.png)

cc @sanmalho-git  please review.
@arlakshm can you review/approve this.

@abdosi - sorry, but am just getting to test this PR out on Nokia's VoQ chassis. 

I see two issues in the minigraph generated with this PR:

- In Cpg
   - Missing BGPRouterDeclaration section for remote asics - <remote_linecard>-ASIC<#>
   - For multi-asic linecard, missing BGPRouterDeclaraion section for my asics - ASIC<#>
- In Dpg, we are missing the DeviceDataPlaneInfo for my asics in a multi-asic linecard
   - This is generated in template_dpg_asic, which is dependent on asic_topo_config. For voq_chassis, asic_topo_config is empty dictionary - as the iBGP connections depend on the what linecards are present in the chassis, and also what asics are on each linecard. This was the reason that I had created a seperate minigraph_dpg_voq template.

> @abdosi - sorry, but am just getting to test this PR out on Nokia's VoQ chassis.
> 
> I see two issues in the minigraph generated with this PR:
> 
> * In Cpg
>   
>   * Missing BGPRouterDeclaration section for remote asics - <remote_linecard>-ASIC<#>
>   * For multi-asic linecard, missing BGPRouterDeclaraion section for my asics - ASIC<#>
> * In Dpg, we are missing the DeviceDataPlaneInfo for my asics in a multi-asic linecard
>   
>   * This is generated in template_dpg_asic, which is dependent on asic_topo_config. For voq_chassis, asic_topo_config is empty dictionary - as the iBGP connections depend on the what linecards are present in the chassis, and also what asics are on each linecard. This was the reason that I had created a seperate minigraph_dpg_voq template.

@sanmalho-git thanks for validating. we will check and fix this by this week.

cc @SuvarnaMeenakshi

My approach to fixing this is to

-	create an almost empty asic topology file for our multi-asic linecard with slot0.
-	In config_sonic_basedon_testbed.yml,  when dealing with ‘voq’ switch_type, before running through the Jinja2 templates, change ‘slot0’ in the asic_topo_config to the ‘slot_num’ that is defined in the inventory.

I have prototyped with this solution, and works fine for both single and multi-asic linecards in a VoQ chassis. 

Below is the asic topology for our multi-asic linecard Nokia_IXR7250e_36x400G card (in vars/topo_Nokia_IXR7250e_36x400G.yml) that I prototyped with:

```
slot0:
    ASIC0:
      topology:
        NEIGH_ASIC:
      configuration_properties:
        common:
          asic_type: FrontEnd 
      configuration:

    ASIC1:
      topology:
        NEIGH_ASIC:
      configuration_properties:
        common:
          asic_type: FrontEnd
      configuration:
```

Please let me know if you are OK with the approach

> My approach to fixing this is to
> 
> * create an almost empty asic topology file for our multi-asic linecard with slot0.
> * In config_sonic_basedon_testbed.yml,  when dealing with ‘voq’ switch_type, before running through the Jinja2 templates, change ‘slot0’ in the asic_topo_config to the ‘slot_num’ that is defined in the inventory.
> 
> I have prototyped with this solution, and works fine for both single and multi-asic linecards in a VoQ chassis.
> 
> Below is the asic topology for our multi-asic linecard Nokia_IXR7250e_36x400G card (in vars/topo_Nokia_IXR7250e_36x400G.yml) that I prototyped with:
> 
> ```
> slot0:
>     ASIC0:
>       topology:
>         NEIGH_ASIC:
>       configuration_properties:
>         common:
>           asic_type: FrontEnd 
>       configuration:
> 
>     ASIC1:
>       topology:
>         NEIGH_ASIC:
>       configuration_properties:
>         common:
>           asic_type: FrontEnd
>       configuration:
> ```
> 
> Please let me know if you are OK with the approach

Thanks @sanmalho-git  this looks fine to me . I assume this is for Problem#2. What about Problem#1 ?

For problem#1, there are some minor fixes in minigraph_cpg.j2.

Also, if I can get the command to generate minigraph of the packet-based chassis topology, that would help me test the solution out for packet based chassis as well.

> For problem#1, there are some minor fixes in minigraph_cpg.j2.
> 
> Also, if I can get the command to generate minigraph of the packet-based chassis topology, that would help me test the solution out for packet based chassis as well.

thanks @sanmalho-git Can you create PR for now ?  I will take your change and verify. Not sure current public code will work to generate chassis-packet template. Will create seprate to make it work if not working.

@abdosi @SuvarnaMeenakshi - PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/4699 has been raised to address the issues with minigraph generation for linecards in a VoQ chasiss. Please review and also add the 'chassis' label to the PR.

@arlakshm instead of new rand_one_dut_frontend_hostname, we could use enum_rand_one_per_hwsku_frontend_hostname which gives us one random frontend DUT per hwsku.  Using this fixture, the test is parameterized for one frontend node per hwsku.

> @arlakshm instead of new rand_one_dut_frontend_hostname, we could use enum_rand_one_per_hwsku_frontend_hostname which gives us one random frontend DUT per hwsku. Using this fixture, the test is parameterized for one frontend node per hwsku.

@sanmalho-git. The fixture `rand_one_dut_frontend_hostname` is a fixture with module scope. The fixture `enum_rand_one_per_hwsku_frontend_hostname ` has the scope of function. Currently there a quite a few tests with use the fixture  `rand_one_dut_hostname`. The idea was to introduce another fixture with scope of module for running the test only on the linecards and replace `rand_one_dut_hostname` with  `rand_one_dut_frontend_hostname` wherever applicable
/Azp run

> @arlakshm 'enum_rand_one_per_hwsku_frontend_node' is a module level fixture as well. This is set at
> 
> https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/fc276577a2e069b11b30e2ccc30ff47d8e35e5ab/tests/conftest.py#L1088

@sanmalho-git, Thanks for the pointer. I have removed the new fixture and modified the tests to use `enum_rand_one_per_hwsku_frontend_node`

@ bpar9 Is there any specific reason to skip this test for cisco-8000? Is there any boot up issue with pdu on/off? This test will be skipped if there is no pdu controller information available in inventory or connection graph file.

> @ bpar9 Is there any specific reason to skip this test for cisco-8000? Is there any boot up issue with pdu on/off? This test will be skipped if there is no pdu controller information available in inventory or connection graph file.

@sujinmkang , the issue is not with the pdu controller. The reason to skip is, currently our platform does not have the capability to log reboot reason when power cycled. We are also investigating more on this to see if there is a way to fix this.

@yxieca Hi Ying, DHCPv6 Relay feature (isc-dhcp) has been cherry-picked to the 202012 branch. https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/8871

Create and merge a PR to change dhcpv6 ptftests to test for only SONiC DHCPv6 Relay (currently it tests for either isc-dhcp or SONiC dhcp6relay)

In reply to: [930067797](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/4388#issuecomment-930067797) [](http://example.com/codeflow?ancestors=930067797)

I believe the `create_vlan_interfaces` method is necessary for some backend topologies, @neethajohn can you confirm? Also @ganglyu can you run the tests on a dual ToR topology and make sure they pass?
AFAIK, this cover both Vlan and Vlan RIF scenarios. I don't think we should remove this unless you see some failures in some scenarios.

> AFAIK, this cover both Vlan and Vlan RIF scenarios. I don't think we should remove this unless you see some failures in some scenarios.

I have verified with t0 topo, and I can't find any issue.
The destination MAC address of test packet is broadcast MAC and PTF port MAC address, so this test only covers layer 2 forwarding. If we want to verify Vlan RIF, the destination must be VLAN RIF MAC address.

> I believe the `create_vlan_interfaces` method is necessary for some backend topologies, @neethajohn can you confirm? Also @ganglyu can you run the tests on a dual ToR topology and make sure they pass?

I have run the tests on a dual ToR topology, and all tests passed.
@lolyu, fyi
@prsunny Do you have concern with this PR?

> @prsunny Do you have concern with this PR?

I think it would be better to wait for reviewers to verify or request for approval before its merged. Anyways, I still didn't get the logic of removing an existing test code if it covers an extra scenario of creating RIFs. This test is also run on BSL and we could identify if there are issues with new code while creating RIFs. Just my thought!

> > @prsunny Do you have concern with this PR?
> 
> I think it would be better to wait for reviewers to verify or request for approval before its merged. Anyways, I still didn't get the logic of removing an existing test code if it covers an extra scenario of creating RIFs. This test is also run on BSL and we could identify if there are issues with new code while creating RIFs. Just my thought!

This PR creates RIFs in def create_test_vlans(duthost, cfg_facts, vlan_ports_list, vlan_intfs_list), should be the same as original test case.
This PR removed below code:
* def create_vlan_interfaces(vlan_ports_list, ptfhost)
* def setUpArpResponder(vlan_ports_list, ptfhost)
* def add_test_routes(duthost, vlan_ports_list)

create_vlan_interfaces is used to create vlan port on ptf host, these vlan ports are never used.
setUpArpResponder is used to start Arp responder on ptf host, and this test case did not send any Arp packet.
add_test_routes is used to add route on DUT, and this test case only tests layer 2 traffic.

There are lot of places where "is_multi_asic" is used. There could be other issues popping up. Have you explored adding a new sonichost type?
cc: @arlakshm

@smaheshm MultiAsicSonicHost in tests/common/devices/multi_asic.py is the class that represents a SonicHost with multiple asics - this has a list of asics in the SonicHost. Even a single asic box is an instance of MultiAsicSonicHost with a single asic. This class allows for seemless compatibility  between single and multi-asic DUTs with minimal changes to be made to make a test be able to run on both DUT types.
